intro: Espeletiopsis rabanalensis, commonly known as the Rabanal espeletiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
